articles.title: Greetings to Russian President
Congratulations to Czech Prime Minister
articles.content:
Congratulations to Czech Prime Minister 
    Pyongyang, May 9 (KCNA) -- Pak Pong Ju, premier of the DPRK Cabinet, sent a congratulatory message to Jiri Parouvek on his appointment as prime minister of the Czech Republic.
 The message expressed the belief that the relations developing on good terms between the two countries will further expand in the mutual interests in the future, too.

Rapid Spread of Brucellosis in S. Korea
articles.content:
Rapid Spread of Brucellosis in S. Korea 
    Pyongyang, May 9 (KCNA) -- Brucellosis, an animal epidemic affecting not only such herbivorous animals as cow but also man is spreading rapidly in
south Korea, according to south Korean MBC.
 The Ministry of Agriculture and Forestry reported that 42 people and 6,200 cows had been infected with this disease by the end of April this year. This is a sharp rise as against last one year when 47 people and 5,300 cows were attacked with the disease, the radio reported.

Rodong Sinmun Observes Day of Russian People's Victory
Kim Yong Nam Greets Russian President
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Greets Russian President
    Pyongyang, May 9 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Monday sent a message of greetings to Vladimir Vladimirovich Putin, Russian president, on the occasion of the 60th anniversary of the victory of the Russian people in the Great Patriotic War.
 The message noted that history would always remember the exploits and contribution the Russian people made by winning a great victory in the fight against the barbarous tyranny of fascism that threatened the existence of humankind.    
 In the belief that the bilateral traditional ties of friendship and cooperation would continue to grow stronger in the future, too, the message sincerely wished the Russian president greater success in his responsible work for the stability and prosperity of the country and the well-being of the people.
